content.question:
Aminolevulinate dehydratase (<math alttext="A L A D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ALAD</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) is an enzyme that relies on zinc as a cofactor. A zinc ion binds to the <math alttext="A L A D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ALAD</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> active site, where it forms favorable interactions with the side chains of three amino acids. Researchers have found that substituting a lead ion for a zinc ion in the <math alttext="A L A D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ALAD</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> active site causes inhibition of <math alttext="A L A D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ALAD</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Which of the following statements best helps explain how the lead ion causes inhibition of <math alttext="A L A D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ALAD</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: It changes the shape and charge of the substrate so that it becomes more compatible with <math alttext="A L A D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ALAD</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>â€™s active site.
It changes the amino acid sequence of the <math alttext="A L A D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ALAD</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein so that the enzyme catalyzes a different reaction.

It changes the three-dimensional structure of the active site so that <math alttext="A L A D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ALAD</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is no longer compatible with its substrate.
It changes the enzyme-substrate complex so that the transition state is more stable and the reaction proceeds at a faster rate.

content.answer: It changes the three-dimensional structure of the active site so that <math alttext="A L A D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ALAD</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is no longer compatible with its substrate.
